summary: Email correspondence between defense attorney Bruce Barket and an unidentified MCC official regarding an investigation into a leak of information about Nicholas Tartaglione, Barket's client, and its connection to Jeffrey Epstein. Barket alleges false information about his client was leaked from the facility following complaints to the court.

persons.name: Bruce Barket
persons.context: Attorney representing Nicholas Tartaglione; emails MCC official alleging a leak of false information about his client from the facility.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Client of Bruce Barket; subject of leaked information and investigation at MCC; story links him to questions about a possible attack on Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in connection to a possible attack at MCC; subject of a news story that Nicholas Tartaglione was questioned about it.

persons.name: Tracy Connor
persons.context: Executive editor at The Daily Beast who emailed Bruce Barket seeking confirmation of an NBC story linking Tartaglione to questions about an attack on Epstein.

connections.description: Barket is the defense attorney representing inmate Nicholas Tartaglione.
Tartaglione was reportedly questioned about a possible attack on Jeffrey Epstein at MCC, according to a news story.

events.title: News Inquiry about Epstein/Tartaglione
events.description: Tracy Connor of The Daily Beast emails Bruce Barket seeking confirmation of an NBC story that his client, Nicholas Tartaglione, was questioned about a possible attack on Jeffrey Epstein at MCC.

events.title: Attorney Complaint about Information Leak
events.description: Bruce Barket corresponds with an MCC official, alleging that false information about his client Nicholas Tartaglione was leaked from the facility following complaints to the court.

locations: Garden City, NY 11530 (Barket Epstein law firm address)
keyFacts: Bruce Barket, attorney for Nicholas Tartaglione, alleges a leak of false information about his client from the MCC facility.
The leak is connected to a news story that Tartaglione was questioned about a possible attack on fellow inmate Jeffrey Epstein.
An MCC official states the matter is under an open investigation and denies sharing information with the press.
The correspondence highlights security and information control concerns within the MCC where Jeffrey Epstein was held.
